title: How to Decorate a Wall Behind a TV Stand

steps.headline: Paint the wall behind your TV a solid color that differs from the rest of the room.
steps.description: This creates a simple but classic look. Use a lighter or darker shade of the same color as the rest of the walls, or a completely different and contrasting color, such as dark grey with other walls that are white. You can then tie the contrasting wall into the rest of the room with accessories, such as curtains and pillows. EXPERT TIP																															Peter Salerno																Installation Expert								Peter Salerno is the owner of Hook it Up Installation, a professional installation company, which has been hanging art and other objects around Chicago, Illinois for over 10 years. Peter also has over 20 years of experience installing art and other mountable objects in residential, commercial, healthcare and hospitality contexts. Peter Salerno			Installation Expert				A solid wall will allow your TV to be the center of attention. Peter Salerno, the owner of Hook It Up Installation, says: "Of course, everyone's house and design styles are different, but in general, I'm not a big fan of hanging stuff over the TV. It can be very distracting."

steps.headline: Paint a bright border on the wall around the TV to make it stand out.
steps.description: This works well on a wall that is not highly textured. Use a different, complimentary color paint to frame the TV from the rest of the wall around it. Use a large ruler to mark points in pencil on the wall for the TV’s central point and then for the rectangular border around it. Use painter’s tape to connect the marks around the box, and go over the edges of the border with the base color of the wall first, to seal the paint to the wall. When this dries, use your border color to fill in the box.

steps.headline: Use a large floral wallpaper for an elegant look.
steps.description: A wallpaper featuring one large, flowered tree branch behind the TV creates another simple but beautiful look. Keep the other walls of the room plain for the best effect.

steps.headline: Create a gallery wall.
steps.description: Try arranging your favorite framed paintings, photos, or posters around the TV to show them off. Simple black frames tie photos and paintings in well with the black rectangular shape of the TV. You can even frame some favorite children’s artwork to hang – they would love it!

steps.headline: Hang your favorite collection up around the TV.
steps.description: Do you have a collection of antique plates, clocks, mirrors, or other mountable objects? Display these around your TV for a unique presentation.

steps.headline: Get creative with stencils or wall decals.
steps.description: Customize your own TV wall with stencils and paint, or with sticker decals for walls. You can leave the rest of the wall plain, or fill in the gaps between with artwork. There are countless decal and stencil options available for creating nature scenes, using favorite quotes, or combining favorite scenery with quotes.

steps.headline: Mount your TV above your fireplace.
steps.description: If you have a fireplace that you can mount a TV above, you’re already one step ahead. Mounting the TV above a fireplace creates multiple focal points for the wall. Fill the fireplace mantle with photos or other art, flowers, or candles.

steps.headline: Set your TV inside built-in bookshelves.
steps.description: If you already have a wall of built-in bookshelves, use them to your advantage by creating a space in the center for your TV. Then just fill the shelves with books, photos, and other art.

steps.headline: Install individual shelves.
steps.description: For an otherwise bare wall, individual wall shelves are a great way to show off sculptures, vases, and other pieces of art near your TV. Place matching shelves in a staggered pattern on the wall, or buy similarly designed shelves of different sizes to create contrast.
